import React from'react';import{withRouter}from'react-router-dom';import'./menu-item.styles.scss';var MenuItem=function MenuItem(_ref){var title=_ref.title,imageUrl=_ref.imageUrl,size=_ref.size,linkUrl=_ref.linkUrl,history=_ref.history,match=_ref.match;return React.createElement("div",{className:"menu-item ".concat(size)},React.createElement("div",{className:"background-image",style:{backgroundImage:"url(".concat(imageUrl,")")}}),React.createElement("div",{className:"content",onClick:function onClick(){return history.push("".concat(match.url).concat(linkUrl));}},React.createElement("h1",{className:"title"},title.toUpperCase()),React.createElement("span",{className:"subtitle"},"SHOP NOW")));};export default withRouter(MenuItem);//it gives you access to the 3 props(history,match,location) Route element pass down to its child which wasn't passed down to their children
